Activities & Adventures

Endless Adventures in Georgia

From mountain peaks to ancient caves, wine regions to cultural experiences - discover the incredible diversity of activities that make Georgia an adventurer's paradise.

Activity Categories

Hiking & Nature

Explore Georgia's stunning natural landscapes and mountain trails

Mtatsminda Mountain Trails

Easy

Scenic trails with panoramic views of Tbilisi

2-3 hours
Free
Spring-Fall
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: Take the funicular up and hike down for easier access

Turtle Lake Hiking

Moderate

Beautiful lake surrounded by forest, perfect for picnics

3-4 hours
Free
Year-round
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: Bring water and snacks, great for sunset views

Tbilisi National Park

Easy-Moderate

Large protected area with diverse flora and fauna

4-6 hours
Free
Spring-Fall
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: Multiple trail options, check weather conditions

Narikala Fortress Walk

Easy

Historic fortress with stunning city views

1-2 hours
Free
Year-round
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: Best at sunset, combine with Old Town exploration

Botanical Garden Exploration

Easy

Beautiful terraced gardens with rare plant species

2-3 hours
15 GEL
Spring-Summer
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: Wear comfortable shoes, bring camera for waterfall

Day Trips

Discover Georgia's rich history and culture on day trips from Tbilisi

Mtskheta Ancient Capital

Easy

UNESCO World Heritage site, former capital of Georgia

6-8 hours
50-80 GEL (transport + guide)
Year-round
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: Combine with Jvari Monastery, try local khachapuri

Jvari Monastery

Easy

6th-century monastery with breathtaking valley views

4-5 hours
40-60 GEL
Year-round
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: Perfect for photography, dress modestly for church visit

Gori and Stalin Museum

Easy

Stalin's birthplace and comprehensive museum

8-10 hours
80-120 GEL
Year-round
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: Controversial but historically significant, guided tour recommended

Uplistsikhe Cave City

Moderate

Ancient rock-hewn town dating back 3,000 years

6-8 hours
70-100 GEL
Spring-Fall
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: Wear sturdy shoes, bring water, amazing for history buffs

Sighnaghi Wine Region

Easy

Charming hilltop town in Georgia's premier wine region

8-10 hours
100-150 GEL
Spring-Fall
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: Book wine tastings in advance, stay overnight for full experience

Adventure Sports

Thrilling outdoor adventures for adrenaline seekers

White Water Rafting

Moderate-Hard

Exciting rafting on Mtkvari and Aragvi rivers

6-8 hours
120-200 GEL
May-September
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: No experience needed, safety equipment provided

Paragliding in Gudauri

Easy (tandem)

Soar over the Caucasus Mountains with professional pilots

4-6 hours
200-300 GEL
June-September
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: Weather dependent, book with certified operators

Rock Climbing

Moderate-Hard

Climbing routes in Tbilisi area and surrounding regions

4-8 hours
80-150 GEL
Spring-Fall
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: Equipment rental available, join local climbing groups

Mountain Biking

Moderate

Scenic mountain bike trails around Tbilisi

4-6 hours
60-100 GEL
Spring-Fall
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: Bike rentals available, helmet mandatory

Skiing in Winter

Easy-Hard

World-class skiing in Gudauri and Bakuriani

Full day
150-250 GEL
December-March
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: Equipment rental on-site, lessons available for beginners

Cultural Activities

Immerse yourself in Georgian culture and traditions

Wine Tasting Tours

Easy

Explore Georgia's 8,000-year winemaking tradition

4-8 hours
80-200 GEL
Year-round
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: Try qvevri wines, learn about traditional methods

Georgian Cooking Classes

Easy

Learn to make khachapuri, khinkali, and other classics

3-4 hours
60-120 GEL
Year-round
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: Book in advance, great for groups and families

Traditional Dance Shows

Easy

Experience Georgian polyphonic singing and folk dances

2-3 hours
30-60 GEL
Year-round
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: Check Rustaveli Theatre schedule, dress nicely

Art Gallery Visits

Easy

Explore contemporary and traditional Georgian art

2-4 hours
10-30 GEL
Year-round
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: Visit during First Friday art walks, many galleries free

Museum Tours

Easy

Discover Georgian history and culture

2-4 hours
15-40 GEL
Year-round
Tip
ðŸ’¡ Tip: National Museum has excellent collections, audio guides available

Seasonal Activity Guide

Spring (March-May)

Best Activities:

  • Hiking as nature awakens
  • Wine region tours begin
  • Botanical garden blooms
  • Mild weather for city walks
  • Easter celebrations

Weather:

Mild temperatures, occasional rain

Tips:

Pack layers, perfect time for outdoor activities

Summer (June-August)

Best Activities:

  • Mountain adventures peak season
  • White water rafting
  • Paragliding in Gudauri
  • Beach trips to Batumi
  • Outdoor festivals

Weather:

Hot and humid in city, cooler in mountains

Tips:

Start early to avoid heat, stay hydrated

Fall (September-November)

Best Activities:

  • Wine harvest season (Rtveli)
  • Perfect hiking weather
  • Cultural events resume
  • Photography tours
  • Mushroom foraging

Weather:

Crisp and clear, ideal conditions

Tips:

Best time to visit, book accommodations early

Winter (December-February)

Best Activities:

  • Skiing in Gudauri/Bakuriani
  • Hot springs visits
  • Indoor cultural activities
  • New Year celebrations
  • Cozy wine tastings

Weather:

Cold with occasional snow

Tips:

Pack warm clothes, some mountain roads may be closed

Top Adventure Destinations

Kazbegi National Park

150km from Tbilisi

Highlights:

Gergeti Trinity ChurchMount Kazbek viewsAlpine hiking

Difficulty:

Moderate-Hard

Best For:

Mountain lovers, photographers

Svaneti Region

350km from Tbilisi

Highlights:

Medieval towersUNESCO heritagePristine mountains

Difficulty:

Hard

Best For:

Serious hikers, culture enthusiasts

Borjomi National Park

160km from Tbilisi

Highlights:

Mineral springsForest trailsHistoric resort town

Difficulty:

Easy-Moderate

Best For:

Families, wellness seekers

Vardzia Cave Monastery

250km from Tbilisi

Highlights:

12th-century cavesHistorical significanceUnique architecture

Difficulty:

Easy

Best For:

History buffs, photographers

Practical Information

Transportation

  • Rent a car for day trips outside Tbilisi
  • Use marshrutkas (minibuses) for budget travel
  • Book tours through reputable agencies
  • Download offline maps for hiking

Safety

  • Georgia is very safe for outdoor activities
  • Always inform someone of your hiking plans
  • Check weather conditions before mountain activities
  • Use certified operators for adventure sports

What to Bring

  • Comfortable hiking boots for trails
  • Layers for changing mountain weather
  • Sunscreen and hat for summer activities
  • Camera for stunning Georgian landscapes

Local Contacts

  • Emergency services: 112
  • Tourist police: 126
  • Download emergency apps
  • Keep hotel contact information handy
